article.title: An Underrated Gem: Top 9 Things To Do In Taoyuan, Taiwan
article.lead_paragraph: It may not be as popular as other Taiwanese cities, but Taoyuan will still give you plenty of unforgettable moments. From the historic wonders of Daxi Old Street to the lush surroundings of Xiao Wulai Scenic Area, Taoyuan is where you can truly appreciate northern Taiwan. These are the top nine things to do in this industrial city. Let the epic journey begin!
article.proposal:
1. Daxi Old Street 
2. Shimen Reservoir 
3. Window On China Theme Park 
4. Cihu Memorial Sculpture Park
5. Yeheng Terraces
6. Xinwu Green Tunnel 
7. Sanmin Bat Cave 
8. Hutou Mountain Park
9. Jhongli Xinming Night Market
10. Xiao Wulai Scenic Area
article.meta_description: Taoyuan is an industrial city in Taiwan, and its scenic attractions and cultural diversity will surely amaze you. Here are the top nine things to do in this beautiful northern metropolis.

snippets.title: 1. Daxi Old Street
snippets.description:
Formed during the Japanese colonial period, Daxi Old Street in Heping Road is your chance to revisit the past. It’s where you will see several Baroque-style shops, all of which are decorated with impressive carvings.  You can visit the shops to buy traditional furniture and toys related to renowned folklores. There are also stores offering famous local treats such as tofu pudding and peanut caramel candy.  When you reach the Daxi Bridge, prepare to be enthralled by the view of the sunset and the night lights.

> #### Daxi Old Street
>
> **Address**:  Heping Road, Daxi District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 335
>
> 
>
> **Opening Hours**:  24 hours
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886 3 388 2201
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 2. Shihmen Reservoir
snippets.description:
It’s one of the country’s largest reservoirs, and apart from providing water and electricity, it’s also a beloved tourist attraction. Shihmen Reservoir will astound you with its lake and mountain views as well as its blooming flowers. Winter is the best time to see the maple leaves and plum blossoms while spring is the season where peaches, cherries, and azaleas shine. If you visit during the rainy season, you will witness the dam release large amounts of water. Don’t forget your camera when you drop by this place.

> #### Shihmen Reservoir
>
> **Address**:  68, Sec. 1, Huanhu Rd., Daxi Dist., Taoyuan City, Daxi Dist., Taoyuan City
>
> **Price**: from 3 USD
>
> **Opening Hours**:  8:00 AM to 6:00 PM
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**: +886-3-471-2000
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 3. Window On China Theme Park
snippets.description:
Window On China is recognized as the first theme park in Asia to have miniature displays of world-renowned buildings. Bring your family or friends and see the impressive little versions of the architectural wonders of Taiwan, China, Europe, America, and the rest of Asia. From Ming Dynasty structures to the Statue of Liberty, this theme park will certainly give you lots of photo opportunities. 

If you want a thrilling experience, then try out the Crazy Rapid ride.  It’s where you will sit on a rafting boat and go through several exciting rapid streams. The Tour Train offers a more laid-back journey. You will board a train and take a trip through the picturesque Lungchan Tea Plantation. Other rides include the roller coaster, Euro Riverboat, Wipe Out, Jumping Stars, and the Egyptian-themed Jumbo Wave. There are also shows featuring acrobatics, magic, and mascots, all of which will entertain both kids and adults.


> #### Window On China Theme Park
>
> **Address**:  891, Gaoyuan Rd, Longtan District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 325
>
> **Price**: from 26 USD
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9:00 AM to 4:30 PM
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886 3 471 7211
>
> 
>
> **Website**: [Window On China Theme Park](http://www.woc.com.tw/index_en.aspx)

snippets.title: 4. Cihu Memorial Sculpture Park
snippets.description:
Cihu Memorial Sculpture Park in Fuxing Road is dedicated to Chiang Kai-shek, the former president of China and a controversial figure in Taiwan. It has over 150 sculptures of Kai-shek, all of which are from government organizations and schools. The most popular is the four-story sculpture in the middle of the garden. Learn more about the politician’s legacy as well as the history of China and Taiwan on your visit here. At the back of the park, there’s a former military zone where you can watch the changing of the guard ceremony at 9:00 AM. Entrance fee to this area is around 3 USD.

> #### Cihu Memorial Sculpture Park
>
> **Address**:  1097, Sec. 1, Fuxing Rd., Daxi Township, Taoyuan County 335, Taiwan
>
> **Price**: Free; 3 USD for the military zone 
>
> **Opening Hours**:  8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886-3-3884437
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 5. Jiaobanshan Park
snippets.description:
Located in Fuxing District, Jiaobanshan Park is where you can appreciate nature and art. Take a stroll and let the different types of trees fascinate you. The maple trees turn red during autumn while the plum trees become pink around February and March. There are also two huge banyan trees resembling a couple embracing each other. Another highlight of the park is the collection of sculptures from some of the most talented artists from Taiwan, Europe, and America.

> #### Jiaobanshan Park
>
> **Address**:  2, Zhongzheng Rd, Fuxing District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 336
>
> **Price**: Free
>
> **Opening Hours**:  24 hours
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886-3-394-6061
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 6. Sanmin Bat Cave
snippets.description:
Even though bats are rarely seen here now, it still has a lot to offer to nature lovers. Sanmin Bat Cave in Fushin Town is well-known for its amphitheatre-like interior and odd-looking rocks. The cave can accommodate over a thousand people. Outside, there’s a waterfall where you can relax after the hike. With its cool breeze, it’s an ideal destination for those who want to escape the summer heat.

> #### Sanmin Bat Cave
>
> **Address**:  336, Taiwan, Taoyuan City, Fuxing District
>
> **Price**: Free
>
> **Opening Hours**:  24 hours
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886-3-382-5052
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 7. Hutou Mountain Park
snippets.description:
This tiger-shaped mountain is considered one of the highest grounds in Taoyuan, and it’s a perfect recreation spot. Hutou Mountain Park in Gongyuan Road will enchant you with its natural forest, Chinese-style tree houses, and views of the Taoyuan Terraces. The park is also the location of historic structures such as the Sansheng Temple, which is dedicated to the heroes of the Three Kingdoms. You can go for a stroll or enjoy a picnic with your family or friends. There’s even a playground for the kids. If you visit at night, you will get a magnificent view of the city lights.

> #### Hutou Mountain Park
>
> **Address**:  42, Gongyuan Rd, Taoyuan District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 330
>
> **Price**: Free
>
> **Opening Hours**:  24 hours
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Contact**:  +886 3 394 6061
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 8. Jhongli Xinming Night Market
snippets.description:
This night market in Xinming Road has over 580 stalls, and it’s sure to give you a memorable shopping and dining experience.  Head to Jhongli Xinming Night Market and enjoy some of the most delicious Taiwanese dishes such as onion pancakes, spicy tofu, fried squid, and pig trotters. If you’re not hungry, then visit the stores selling imported clothes and electronics. What makes this night market even more awesome is its convenient location. If you’re coming from Jhongli Station, you can reach it by a 10-minute walk.

> #### Jhongli Xinming Night Market 
>
> **Address**:  Xinming Road, Zhongli District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 320
>
> 
>
> **Opening Hours**:  5:00 PM to 1:00 AM
>
> 
>
> **Access**: 10-minute walk from Jhongli Station
>
> **Contact**:  +886 3 494 8816
>
> 
>
>

snippets.title: 9. Xiao Wulai Scenic Area
snippets.description:
More natural wonders are waiting for you at Xiao Wulai Scenic Area in Fuxing Town. Go for a journey on the transparent skywalk and fall in love with the lush scenery and the panoramic view of the three-tiered Xiao Wulai Waterfall. The waterfall is about 50 meters (164 feet) high and is one of the area’s most popular attractions. You will also see the huge 50 ton (110,231 pound) Wind Moving Rock, which remains balanced despite its precarious position.

> #### Xiao Wulai Scenic Area
>
> **Address**:  42,Yixeng,Fuxing Town,Taoyuan County,Taiwan
>
> **Price**: from 2 USD
>
> **Opening Hours**:  8:00 AM to 5:00 PM (closed on Mondays)
>
> 
>
> 
>
> 
>
> 
>
> **Website**: [Xiao Wulai Scenic Area (Chinese Website)](http://skywalk.tycg.gov.tw/Skywalk/)

snippets.title: Lovely Taoyuan
snippets.description: Taoyuan is proof that even the lesser-known cities of Taiwan are marvelous. Let the treasures of this northern city leave you in awe. These are only ten places, and there’s definitely more for you to see.

embed.value: Taoyuan is proof that even the lesser-known cities of Taiwan are marvelous. Let the treasures of this northern city leave you in awe. These are only ten places, and there’s definitely more for you to see.

navigator.introduction: Freelance writer by day, rap artist by night. When he's not making music or joining rap battles, Paolo writes about anything under the sun. Throughout his eight-year experience as a copywriter, he has written about films, satirical news, and travel (his favorite topic). One item he wishes to cross off on his bucket list is a trip to New York City. The city's colourful art, film, and music culture is something that he wanted to witness firsthand. He has been to Sagada, Calaguas, Caramoan, Nagsasa, Bagasbas, and many other beloved Philippine destinations, each of which made him appreciate travelling even more.
